text:
47 Ronin is a 2013 American 3D period fantasy action-adventure film depicting a fictional account of the forty-seven rōnin, a real-life group of masterless samurai in 18th-century Japan who avenged the death of their lord in the style of Chūshingura. Starring Keanu Reeves and Hiroyuki Sanada, the film was produced by H2F Entertainment, Mid Atlantic Films, Moving Picture Company and Stuber Productions, and was released theatrically by Universal Pictures on December 25, 2013 in the United States.
The film received generally negative reviews from critics but some reviewers bestowed praise for the action scenes and visuals. 47 Ronin grossed $151 million against its total budget of $175 million, making it a costly box office bomb which left Universal deeply in the red for 2013. Adjusted for inflation, it lost an estimated $152 million. Variety magazine listed 47 Ronin as one of "Hollywood's biggest box office bombs of 2013".
